oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nitrogen management on large organic dairy farms
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eriksen, J.
Askegaard, M.
Søegaard, K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nutrient turnover
Farm nutrient management
Air and water emissions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Large dairy herds need much grassland near the farm. Utilisation and losses of nitrogen in such grass-intensive crop rotations can be controlled by management: In grassland, grazing days or fertiliser input can be reduced, and following grassland cultivation, a barley whole crop for silage undersown with Italian ryegrass can reduce leaching to a minimum.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Eriksen, J.; Askegaard, M. and Søegaard, K. (2009) Nitrogen management on large organic dairy farms. Newsletter from the International Centre for Research in Organic Food Systems 2, 2009, p. 2.
